com.mindfusion.scheduling

Class ResourceViewSettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mindfusion.scheduling.ViewSettings
      • com.mindfusion.scheduling.ResourceViewSettings

  • public class ResourceViewSettings
extends ViewSettings
    Defines properties that allow customizing the visualization of the calendar in Resource view.

      • getTimelineScale

        public java.lang.Integer getTimelineScale()
        Description copied from class: ResourceViewSettings
        Gets the scale factor of the timeline.

        Usually the size of the cells in the CalendarView.ResourceView is calculated to be large enough so that the texts in the timeline can fit without clipping. By using values other than 100 for this property, you can scale up or down the precalculated size of the cells.

        Returns:
        An integer value specifying the scale of the timeline expressed in percents. The allowed values range from 10 to 1000.

      • setTimelineScale

        public void setTimelineScale(java.lang.Integer value)
        Description copied from class: ResourceViewSettings
        Sets the scale factor of the timeline.

        Usually the size of the cells in the CalendarView.ResourceView is calculated to be large enough so that the texts in the timeline can fit without clipping. By using values other than 100 for this property, you can scale up or down the precalculated size of the cells.

        Parameters:
        value - An integer value specifying the scale of the timeline expressed in percents. The allowed values range from 10 to 1000. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

        This property is only used if ViewStyle is set to ResourceViewStyle.Lanes.

        Returns:
        A Boolean value. true to activate this feature or false to turn it off.

        public java.lang.Integer getRowHeaderSize()
        Description copied from class: ResourceViewSettings
        Gets the size of the row header.

      • getMinItemSize

        public java.lang.Integer getMinItemSize()
        Description copied from class: ResourceViewSettings
        Gets the smallest size allowed for resource items.

        If there is not enough space in a row to display all related items, the items that do not fit remain invisible. This property is only used when ViewStyle is set to General.

        Returns:
        An integer value, specifying the minimal item size in pixels. The minimal allowed value is 5.

      • getSnapUnit

        public TimeUnit getSnapUnit()
        Description copied from class: ResourceViewSettings
        Gets the snap unit.

        Specifies the time unit of the nearest value to align to when an item is being modified interactively. For example specifying Day causes the manipulated item to always be aligned to the nearest day. To practically disable snapping, specify Second for this property.

        Returns:
        One of the TimeUnit constants.

      • setSnapUnit

        public void setSnapUnit(TimeUnit value)
        Description copied from class: ResourceViewSettings
        Sets the snap unit.

        Specifies the time unit of the nearest value to align to when an item is being modified interactively. For example specifying Day causes the manipulated item to always be aligned to the nearest day. To practically disable snapping, specify Second for this property.

        Parameters:
        value - One of the TimeUnit constants. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getSnapUnitCount

        public java.lang.Integer getSnapUnitCount()
        Description copied from class: ResourceViewSettings
        Gets the snap unit count.

        When ResourceViewSettings.getSnapUnitCount() is 1 the snapping is absolute. When ResourceViewSettings.getSnapUnitCount() is greater than 1, then the snapping is relative to the element being dragged. For example, if the item is moved or its start is being resized, the snapping is relative to the item's start. If the item's end is being resized, the snapping is relative to the item's end. For example, if the item starts at 02/16, the unit count is 3 and the unit is Day, an attempt to resize the item's start on the left would cause snapping at 02/13 (which is the item's start time minus 3 days).

        Returns:
        A positive integer value specifying the number of units from the associated SnapUnit to snap to.

      • setSnapUnitCount

        public void setSnapUnitCount(java.lang.Integer value)
        Description copied from class: ResourceViewSettings
        Sets the snap unit count.

        When ResourceViewSettings.getSnapUnitCount() is 1 the snapping is absolute. When ResourceViewSettings.getSnapUnitCount() is greater than 1, then the snapping is relative to the element being dragged. For example, if the item is moved or its start is being resized, the snapping is relative to the item's start. If the item's end is being resized, the snapping is relative to the item's end. For example, if the item starts at 02/16, the unit count is 3 and the unit is Day, an attempt to resize the item's start on the left would cause snapping at 02/13 (which is the item's start time minus 3 days).

        Parameters:
        value - A positive integer value specifying the number of units from the associated SnapUnit to snap to. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getShowPaddingDates

        public java.lang.Boolean getShowPaddingDates()
        Description copied from class: ResourceViewSettings
        Gets a value indicating whether to display padding dates.

        It is sometimes possible that the control draws dates outside of the range specified by the Date and EndDate properties. This usually happens when the viewport is larger than the entire time range. Set this property to false if you don't want the control to draw external dates.

        Returns:
        A Boolean value.

      • setShowPaddingDates

        public void setShowPaddingDates(java.lang.Boolean value)
        Description copied from class: ResourceViewSettings
        Sets a value indicating whether to display padding dates.

        It is sometimes possible that the control draws dates outside of the range specified by the Date and EndDate properties. This usually happens when the viewport is larger than the entire time range. Set this property to false if you don't want the control to draw external dates.

        Parameters:
        value - A Boolean value. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getHiddenDays

        public java.util.EnumSet<DayOfWeek> getHiddenDays()
        Description copied from class: ResourceViewSettings
        Gets the days of the week that should not be displayed in a resource view.

        This property determines which days should be filtered (that is, not displayed) in a resource view. This setting only works if the Unit of the bottom timeline is set to Day or Hour.

        Returns:
        One or more of the DayOfWeek constants indicating the visible days in a ResourceView.

      • setHiddenDays

        public void setHiddenDays(java.util.EnumSet<DayOfWeek> value)
        Description copied from class: ResourceViewSettings
        Sets the days of the week that should not be displayed in a resource view.

        This property determines which days should be filtered (that is, not displayed) in a resource view. This setting only works if the Unit of the bottom timeline is set to Day or Hour.

        Parameters:
        value - One or more of the DayOfWeek constants indicating the visible days in a ResourceView.

      • getVisibleStartTime

        public Duration getVisibleStartTime()
        Description copied from class: ResourceViewSettings
        Gets the first visible time of displayed days.

        This property along with the VisibleEndTime property determine the range of hours displayed in a resource view for each day. The rest of the day is filtered (that is, the hours outside this range are not displayed). Despite being a Duration, only the Hour component is taken into consideration when filtering. Furthermore, this setting only works if the Unit property of the bottom timeline is set to Hour and the UnitCount is set to 1 or if the Unit is set to Minute.

        Returns:
        A Duration value indicating the first visible hour of the day in a ResourceView.

      • setVisibleStartTime

        public void setVisibleStartTime(Duration value)
        Description copied from class: ResourceViewSettings
        Sets the first visible time of displayed days.

        This property along with the VisibleEndTime property determine the range of hours displayed in a resource view for each day. The rest of the day is filtered (that is, the hours outside this range are not displayed). Despite being a Duration, only the Hour component is taken into consideration when filtering. Furthermore, this setting only works if the Unit property of the bottom timeline is set to Hour and the UnitCount is set to 1 or if the Unit is set to Minute.

        Parameters:
        value - A Duration value indicating the first visible hour of the day in a ResourceView.

Furthermore, this setting only works if the Unit property of the bottom timeline is set to Hour and the UnitCount is set to 1 or if the Unit is set to Minute.

      • getEnableRowTitleFormat

        public java.lang.Boolean getEnableRowTitleFormat()
        Description copied from class: ResourceViewSettings
        Gets a value indicating whether the RowTitleFormat property will be taken into consideration.

        If this property is disabled the title of each row is determined by to the type of resources the view is currently grouped by. If the view is grouped by contacts, the title displays the FirstName, MiddleName and LastName of the contact according to the pattern specified by Calendar.getContactNameFormat(). If the view is grouped by locations or resources, the title displays the Name of the resource. If the view is grouped by tasks, the title displays the Subject of the task.

        Returns:
        A Boolean value.

      • setEnableRowTitleFormat

        public void setEnableRowTitleFormat(java.lang.Boolean value)
        Description copied from class: ResourceViewSettings
        Sets a value indicating whether the RowTitleFormat property will be taken into consideration.

        If this property is disabled the title of each row is determined by to the type of resources the view is currently grouped by. If the view is grouped by contacts, the title displays the FirstName, MiddleName and LastName of the contact according to the pattern specified by Calendar.getContactNameFormat(). If the view is grouped by locations or resources, the title displays the Name of the resource. If the view is grouped by tasks, the title displays the Subject of the task.

        Parameters:
        value - A Boolean value. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getRowTitleFormat

        public java.lang.String getRowTitleFormat()
        Description copied from class: ResourceViewSettings
        Gets the string used to format and display resource titles in row headers.

        The ResourceViewSettings.getRowTitleFormat() represents raw text containing property references enclosed in curly brackets. The following is an example of a formatting string containing a single reference to a property called Name:

        This is {Name}.

        The value of the referenced property is obtained from the resource object associated with the row whose title is being formatted with this string.

        Returns:
        A string specifying the display format.

      • setRowTitleFormat

        public void setRowTitleFormat(java.lang.String value)
        Description copied from class: ResourceViewSettings
        Sets the string used to format and display resource titles in row headers.

        The ResourceViewSettings.getRowTitleFormat() represents raw text containing property references enclosed in curly brackets. The following is an example of a formatting string containing a single reference to a property called Name:

        This is {Name}.

        The value of the referenced property is obtained from the resource object associated with the row whose title is being formatted with this string.

        Parameters:
        value - A string specifying the display format. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.
